abstract.p: Stephen R Bruckner letter holds Bush administration's policy on global warming is consistent with a strategy of not destroying nation's economy (July 19 editorial)

block.p: Re ''Clueless on Global Warming'' (editorial, July 19): It seems that your definition of ''clueless'' is honest disagreement with your opinion. The Bush administration's policy is entirely consistent with a strategy of not destroying our country's economy.

Re ''Clueless on Global Warming'' (editorial, July 19): It seems that your definition of ''clueless'' is honest disagreement with your opinion. The Bush administration's policy is entirely consistent with a strategy of not destroying our country's economy.

Any limit on carbon dioxide emissions from power plants is unnecessary and would only harm the economy. Any good capitalist power-plant operator seeks to minimize the emission of carbon dioxide since it is directly proportional to fuel consumption, a major operating expense for power generation.

Insisting on an emissions limit would only reduce the generation of electric power and cause economic contraction since no non-fossil energy source could be brought online quickly enough to offset the reduction. The administration's call to revive the use of nuclear energy is actually a strong policy statement directed at reducing carbon dioxide emissions.
STEPHEN R. BRUECKNER Clarkston, Mich., July 21, 2001
